title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is <.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. $$y<\frac{1}{3} x-\frac{4}{3}$$ $$0<0\frac{1}{3}-\frac{4}{3}$$ $$0<\frac{-4}{3}$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is not a solution to $$y<\frac{1}{3} x-\frac{4}{3}$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, we shade the right side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph Second Inequality
text: Graph $$y \leq -1$$ on the same grid. Recognize that it is a horizontal line through $$y=-1$$.

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \leq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. $$y \leq -1$$ $$0 \leq -1$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is not a solution to $$y \leq -1$$. Since (0,0) is on the top side of the line, so we shade in the bottom side of the line $$y=-1$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
